paper.title: European Option Pricing by Using the Support Vector Regression Approach
paper.abstract: We explore the pricing performance of Support Vector Regression for pricing S&P 500 index call options. Support Vector Regression is a novel nonparametric methodology that has been developed in the context of statistical learning theory, and until now it has not been widely used in financial econometric applications. This new method is compared with the Black and Scholes (1973) option pricing model, using standard implied parameters and parameters derived via the Deterministic Volatility Functions approach. The empirical analysis has shown promising results for the Support Vector Regression models.

domain_result.justification: 该论文的核心研究内容是使用支持向量回归方法来定价S&P 500指数看涨期权，这直接属于衍生品定价领域。论文还比较了该方法与Black-Scholes模型的表现，进一步确认了其在衍生品定价中的应用。
